name: Vitamin D
overview: Vitamin D is a video analysis startup that can identify objects in footage and allows users to search through it later.

milestones.description: Vitamin D Video Surveillance System Sheds Beta Tag, Announces Pricing
milestones.source_text:
Vitamin D Video has officially gone out of beta and is now available in 1.0. The basic, single camera version of the software is available now for free while a two camera version costs $49 and unlimited cameras costs $199. The software watches a web-based camera â€“ including many popular models from Linksys and D-Link â€“ and records motion as it it happens, even alerting you when humans step into the frame.

Iâ€™ve been using the beta for months now with a Linksys WVC54GCA and I consider the software an early warning system for the home. Since I work up in the attic I canâ€™t always tell if Iâ€™m facing a friend or a foe at the front door so I rely on Vitamin D to ping whenever someone comes into the frame. Special motion sensing systems also pick up lights and other activity outside while the system can also email clips to a mailbox whenever an event occurs or ring a chime.
milestones.source_description: Vitamin D Video Surveillance System Sheds Beta Tag, Announces Pricing
